content: Career Asked by AnonymousAsked on 29 Oct 2018What should I choose: a good boss or better opportunity?I am currently employed in a very small company with only 7 people. I love my boss. He cares for us even outside work. However, I think I am not growing. Also, the salary is small. But a big opportunity came. A multi-national company is offering me a job that doubles my salary and career growth is also good. Should I accept it even my boss is too good to leave?4 answersAnswerBump0

MasterAnswered on 29 Oct 2018If you really value the company and you feel taht the boss is a big factor of job satisfaction, then why not ask the boss if there are bigger jobscopes and more things you can do, so that you are forced out of your comfort zone, and can learn more as well?If the boss likes it comfortable, and you want to grow, then sure, move to the bigger company! Who's to say you won't meet a better boss who both cares for you, and still is able to take you to new heights and new abilities. Not only will you grow personally, but also grow financially.I just want to put it out there that "nice boss" doesn't mean "good boss". It's great to have a nice boss, but you won't be challenged by someone just being "nice"Think about which you rather have, and go for it!0 comments4
